targets.query:
from(bucket: "iot_bucket")
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_measurement"] == "machine_telemetry")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["sector"] == "sector_1")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["line"] == "line_1")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["engine"] == "engine_1")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["sensor_type"] == "current")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_field"] == "value" or r["_field"] == "warning_limit" or r["_field"] == "critical_limit")
  |> aggregateWindow(every: v.windowPeriod, fn: last, createEmpty: false)
  |> map(fn: (r) => ({
      r with 
      _field: 
        if r._field == "value" then "Amp" 
        else if r._field == "warning_limit" then "Warning" 
        else "Critical"
    })
  )
  |> yield(name: "current")

from(bucket: "iot_bucket")
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_measurement"] == "machine_telemetry")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["sector"] == "sector_1")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["line"] == "line_1")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["engine"] == "engine_1")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["sensor_type"] == "vibration")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_field"] == "value" or r["_field"] == "warning_limit" or r["_field"] == "critical_limit")
  // 1. Convertiamo TUTTO (valore e limiti) in mm/s
  |> map(fn: (r) => ({ r with _value: r._value * 31.21 }))
  |> aggregateWindow(every: v.windowPeriod, fn: last, createEmpty: false)
  // 2. Rinominiamo
  |> map(fn: (r) => ({
      r with 
      _field: 
        if r._field == "value" then "Vib" 
        else if r._field == "warning_limit" then "Warning" 
        else "Critical"
    })
  )
  |> yield(name: "vibration")

from(bucket: "iot_bucket")
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_measurement"] == "ai_predictions")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["sector"] == "sector_1")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["line"] == "line_1")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["engine"] == "engine_1")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["sensor_type"] == "ai_rul")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_field"] == "value" or r["_field"] == "warning_threshold")
  |> aggregateWindow(every: v.windowPeriod, fn: last, createEmpty: false)
  |> yield(name: "RUL")

// 1. Definiamo i target 

target_sector = /^${sector}$/
target_line   = /^${line}$/
target_engine = /^${engine}$/ // InfluxDB mostra "engine", non "asset"

from(bucket: "iot_bucket")
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_measurement"] == "machine_telemetry")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["sector"] =~ target_sector)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["line"]   =~ target_line)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["engine"] =~ target_engine)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["sensor_type"] == "current")
  
  // 2. Chiediamo sia il valore che i limiti
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_field"] == "value" or r["_field"] == "warning_limit" or r["_field"] == "critical_limit")
  |> keep(columns: ["_time", "_value", "_field", "engine", "line", "sector"])
  
  // 3. Rinominiamo i campi per renderli leggibili nelle opzioni
  |> map(fn: (r) => ({
      r with 
      _field: 
        if r._field == "value" then "Corrente (A)" 
        else if r._field == "warning_limit" then "Warning" 
        else "Critical"
    })
  )
  |> yield(name: "data_with_limits")

list.definition:
from(bucket: "iot_bucket")
  |> range(start: -1h)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["sector"] == "${sector}")
  |> keep(columns: ["line"])
  |> distinct(column: "line")
  |> keep(columns: ["_value"])
list.label: Linea
list.name: line

  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["line"] == "${line}")
